answers.answer: Hi How is your health is now?You did't post that.As to your question you could develop gestational diabietes,then you baby would be large.Taking fertility blends for three months I don't know,I'm not familar with that.You need to talk to your doctor,he or she can give you more information on that better than I can.Maybe somebody else on this forum might know about it.But I don't.I just know about the risks for getting pregnant at an older age.The higher risks there are for the fetus to develop down syndrome,your doctor will check you quite often and you will have more follow up appointments than a regular prenatal patient.But that is what you would need.As I am sure that is what he or she  done the first time.I hope this helps maybe you will get more posts from some one smarter than me,sorry.TNT406.

TNT--you're very smart!Pregnancy is harder on the body at older ages, and your chances of problems increase pretty much as you said.  Along with an increased chance of Down's syndrome, overall chromosomal abnormalities might show up more frequently.  The older mother is at increased risk of gestational diabetes and pregnancy induced hypertension as well as preterm labor and other potential problems.Impossible?  No.  But considering pregnancy at that age should be done with careful thought and with good obstetricial care.

question: Would like to have a 2nd child at age 45 years.  1st child healthy pregancy no complications atage 38 years.  What problems if any, may arise.  Is it OK to take Fertility Blend for 3 months prior to aid in conception.
title: Wants to have 2nd child at 45 years age.  1st child was at 38 years. Normal preg
